availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Sanders (Hancock County, Kentucky, physician and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, physician. Hopkinsville, Kentucky, native. Son of Hardin Sanders and Paulina Sanders. Married to Mary C. Dills Sanders in Hancock County on August 4, 1859. Student in Hancock County in 1850. Physician in Hancock County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 297A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 1018.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, Georgetown Township, p. 164A.
Find A Grave, "Dr Isaac Sanders (1834-1903)," Memorial 103198652, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/103198652 (accessed November 18, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729, p. 271.
Texas Department of State Health Services. Texas Death Certificates, 1903-1982. Austin, TX. Dallas County Deaths, Certificate #48782 (Marion H. Sanders), p. 806 of microfilm.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
